p: Compounds 253, 289– 291 were assayed for their antibacterial activities against Escherichia coli, Staphylococcus aureus, and Salmonella typhimurium. All of the four compounds exhibited antibacterial activities against Escherichia coli, Salmonella typhimurium, and Staphylococcus aureus with the same MIC values of 25 µg/mL, 50 µg/mL and 25 µg/mL, respectively. Ampicillin was the positive control against bacteria, the MIC of ampicillin was lower than 0.78 μg/mL against Salmonella typhimurium, and Staphylococcus aureus, while the MIC value against Escherichia coli was 100 µg/mL [ 83].
